title: The First Thing a New League Player Learns.
body:
Fun stuff when I bring two friends into the game who are new and we immediately get a butthurt ADC who starts running it down.

So I taught them the first thing a new league player should learn.

Not buying items, not warding, not certain champs. But how to report other players.

replies.body: Don't you need to play bot games 1st? So you either taught nothing to them until level 5, or you had them report people in bot games...
If you're a dick you get reported. I don't care if it's botgames, normals or ranked.
I just doubt someone was a dick in bot games. I do missions in some accounts in bots and I have never seen a flamer. Could be just good luck though.

I am willing to accept there are humans who will flame teammates for dying to a bot.  I don't think they are common, I really want to not have them be common.  The game is better off with out some one who flames newbies.  Its PvP so with no one to play then ya have no game. Population growth is a good thing imo.
sounds like you all need thicker skin.  a bad player shouldn't prolong someone learning how to play.  I would have taught them how to farm safely and play from behind.
